characters: GET UP, BITCH. BITCH, GET UP
THE REAL KATE CATES. WE ARE
WHY AM I THE ONLY ONE HERE
THIN BLONDE IN FRONT OF CHRISTMAS TREE
THIN BLONDE, THIN BLONDE, THIN BLONDE
HURRY. JUST THROW THEM DOWN AND DON'T

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You always look so beautiful... especially in the morning. Tara smiles her thanks. They begin to kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara RACES past the receptionist's desk. DANA SMALL sits above it all, neat and petite, up to the minute fashion a hair.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: SHE'S NOT HERE YET -—- Tara visibly relaxes and walks back. Dana slides a Starbu coffee across the reception desk.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Thanks, did she call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told her you were in the bathroom. (giving Tara the once-over Am I having Deja Vu? Tara nods. Dana unbuttons her cardigan, After a moment, T does the same. They take off their sweaters and EXCHANGE.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Saving me from the walk of shame and coffee, too! Oh booba, what would I do without you?

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: You'd be a tired, fired, slut.

dialogues.speaker: TARA'S DESK
dialogues.text: Tara is buried beneath a pile of papers. She answers multiple lines, types, swivels around to check on her bos AUDREY LANFORD, who is now in her office on the phone. Tara's desk is directly across from Dana's. The Phone RIN

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Audrey Lanford's office.

dialogues.speaker: DANA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: So...did he say it? Tara turns her attention to Dana who also wears a headset they just raised their voices they could talk normally.

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: No. But he's giving me a drawer.

dialogues.speaker: DANA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Sounds like love to me. (holding up a list) Here's the final list of all the people coming. I got a hold of James Linfield this morning. He sounded cute. Tara checks him off her list.

dialogues.speaker: DANA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Is he?

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: I haven't met him...I haven't met any of these people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get their numbers?

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Work...his secretary, his phone book.

dialogues.speaker: DANA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: You just randomly went through his phone book?

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yeah...what? Dana gets up and crosses over to Tara.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: What if you invited ex-girlfriends? Tara looks at the list as if for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I'd be okay with that, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Not you...him. Here are all your ex- girlfriends from the past five years! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: He hasn’t had any serious relationships here...he's never mentioned anyone.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: He's a good-looking, single, straight money maker in Manhattan. Obviously if you've never heard even a name of an ex, you just haven't had that talk yet. Tara suddenly looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: When are you supposed to have that talk?

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Never. Tara glances over to the cubicle next to hers.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Just pretend you can't hear us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the relationship gets serious.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: We're serious.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: But you haven't said "I love you" or talked about moving in together or marriage -- Dana is interrupted by an EXPLOSION OF APPLAUSE AND CHEER They turn to see -~- GROUP OF MALE CO-WORKERS “high fivin’” each other as a CA KLEIN BILLBOARD goes up across the street. It’s a panel t size of a football field of a woman’s thigh leading to he Barbie doll waist.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I might not know every little detail about Nate’s past, but I do know he isn’t into pre-pubescent, anorexic, airbrushed, fake fantasy models. (looking at slobbering men) I’m finally in a relationship where I don’t have to be suspicious and worried all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cozy table by the window. Nate and Tara lean into one another, talking. A WAITER comes to the table carrying a BIRTHDAY CAKE with a candle. Nate leans across the table kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate tries to unlock the door while unbuttoning the hundr pearl buttons down Tara's back.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I'm not going to get this off of you until midnight -- Tara wriggles around to face him.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Careful, it's vintage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: It's early...we haven't really celebrated your birthday, we could go dancing?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I'm just looking forward to being alone with you. Nate kisses her while pushing open the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flicks on the light --

dialogues.speaker: SURPRISE
dialogues.text: Nate grabs Tara as DOZENS pop out of nowhere. He quickly looks around to see all his FRIENDS and CO-WORKERS. He smiles at Tara, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Tara and Dana stand off to the side, watching late GUESTS arrive. Beautiful WOMAN after beautiful WOMAN walk throug the door. Dana nudges Tara as they greet Nate.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: That was casual... A tall, BLONDE brushes Nate's cheek with a "hello", a BRUNETTE waits her turn. They hug. DANA (cont'd) That was a little warmer than just co- worker, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Dana ~~ But you can see that Tara is evaluating each and every wo the same way. She straightens her dress self-consciously. TARA (cont'd) I better get their coats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate talks with a slick-looking, Wall Street-type, ALEX M

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: All I know is she's back and she's asking about you.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I'm in a relationship, Alex. (shrugging) Tara's only twenty-two...but she doesn't play mind games, she knows who she is. (taking a drink) I'm the fucked up one.

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCE TO HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Tara staggers forward carrying a huge PILE of COATS.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: But aren't you even a little curious to see her? Tara FREEZES. She cranes her neck around the coats, they haven't seen her yet.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: No. (beat) So..-how is she?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: See...see, you are. You think about her, too. Don't deny it! realizes Tara quickly steps all the way into the closet, closing t slatted door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara presses her face against the slats, watching Nate.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Things are going well with Tara --

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You've only been going out with her a couple of months --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: (whispers) Six --

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You're not married, you're not even living with her -- Tara watches on in horror.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I'm not calling her.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You two were a great couple --

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: And then she dumped me and moved to London --

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: And now she’s back --

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What do you care? Alex crosses his arms.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I just think there might still be something there between you two. When you two got engaged, you were the envy of every guy I knew -- Tara’s mouth drops open. ALEX (cont’d) She’s so smart, and beautiful...incredible --

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: So, you ran into her?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No, I heard through George that she’s still talking about ‘you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s all in the past, now. I’m going to get a drink. Nate walks away. Alex follows.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I just want you to be sure about this. Tara follows them with her eyes, unaware as a MAN opens t closet door. Tara BURSTS forward, FALLING ON TOP OF HIM, burying him under coats.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: The party is over. Dozens of glasses cover every surface. Ashtrays and wine bottles and general post-party disarray Tara follows Nate, collecting glasses.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: So you liked everyone that came...and no one was missing?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: No, in fact, there were a few people I wouldn't expect at my birthday party.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Oh?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: My accountant...uh, my dentist and my plumber all assured me that they had a great time.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I wasn't sure from your phone book... (laughing) But that was alright?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Great. I'm scheduled for a free cleaning next week, my taxes will be done early this year and if we ever have a blockage, we can call Phil at home. (kissing her) Thank you. Nate picks up more glasses, heading for the kitchen. Tara follows.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: You have so many nice friends...George and his wife Sandy, you know, the newlyweds...they seem so happy. Of course I've never been close to getting married, so I wouldn't know about that. (beat) What about you?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Marriage? Not really.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Did you ever feel like proposing. ..looked at rings, that kind of thing?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Why are you asking?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I don't know...I just realized after talking to all your friends...and people from work, that there's a lot of stuff I don't know. Like...were any of your ex- girlfriends here tonight?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: So, do you see any of your ex— girlfriends, are you still friends with any of them?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: It would be fine if you were, I'm just asking. Is there anyone you would like to keep in contact with?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Did Dana put you up to this?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: What? No.  10.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t take advice from a woman who can’t even commit to a long distance carrier --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I just realized we haven’t had this talk yet.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You mean the interrogation?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I can tell you about my ex-boyfriends --

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: No thank you.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I just mean I can share -—

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I don't think the past has anything to do with us, with what we have right now. Look, things are going well, right? You're happy? Nate takes Tara's hands in his.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Yes, but I don't like the idea of other people..acquaintances of yours, knowing more about you than I do --

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: If something came up that was about one of them, something relevant -~—

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: We're talking about it. It's relevant -—

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Why do you want to know this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: To bring us closer together. Nate pulls her into an embrace.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I can think of better ways of bringing us closer together.  11.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: (smiles) Alright...I’m letting you off the hook now, but I do want to talk about it...later, because I want to know you better and because... She stares into his eyes...and she can't stop herself. TARA (cont'd) I love you. There, she said it, blurted it, really. Nate stares deeply back into her eyes. They stay this way for what feels like forever. He pulls her close and then kisses her...on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: On the forehead? Tara nods sullenly. DANA (cont'd) Oh my God. Tara, what did I tell you? Never, ever, ever, ever say it first --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Too late.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Look, it's so basic. We're animals, just watch dogs. It's the males who go around sniffing our butts, not the other way around --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I think it's a little more complicated than that --

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Is it? Rudge broke up with me because I made it too easy for him. I liked him and let it show, and what did he do to repay me? He went back to his bitchy ex- girlfriend who treated him like shit. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANA (cont'd) I treated him like a God and to repay me he skated. By telling Nate you love him, you've disturbed nature's balance. Tara puts her head on the table.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Please...I can't breathe... Dana lowers her face to Tara's level.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Let's just go over what you heard again. Tara sits up.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: She was the most intense relationship he ever had. He almost married her. Everyone wanted her. He was in love with her and so was everyone else --

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Got it. So, you may be the rebound.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Rebound...oh God, that's gotta be it. (beat) And he wouldn't tell me about her last night because...he's still in love with her. Dana, what if that's it? He thought this woman was out of his life, and now she's back...and he can't stop thinking about her. That's why he didn't say he loved me back. Tara starts to cry. Dana hands her a tissue, patting her the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Hold on. Maybe not. Let me think... Tara wipes her tears, hopeful. DANA (cont'd) (long beat) On the forehead? Tara lets her head drop back onto the table. CuT TO:  13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone else has left except for Tara and Dana who walk together. They step onto:

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: You're going to go back there, act like nothing is wrong. Act confident. They sense that. He may just be waiting for an appropriate time to tell you he loves you. Don't sweat it. Confidence. Tara nods to her coach, straightens her coat.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Confident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara KNOCKS. After a moment Nate answers the door. He kisses her right away.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Hey...I thought I'd stop by...on the way home from work.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Great. C'mon in... (beat) You want something to drink...eat? Nate heads back to the kitchen. Tara wanders around the apartment, passing the bedroom. She STOPS in her tracks w she sees a SUITCASE on the bed, PACKED.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Nate...where are you going? Nate appears.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I tried to tell you before the party... Nate looks at Tara. NATE (cont'd) I have a job interview in San Francisco. It's for a non-profit...a friend set me up with these people...I wasn't looking.  14.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: San Francisco? That’s in a different time zone. Nate takes Tara's hands in his.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I haven't even thought this through. I...I'm just going to see... He hugs her, but doesn't say any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate hands her a key.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I'll be gone for a week...if you could feed Uncle Pussy. Make sure you feed him twice a day, he'll scavenge if you don't...make sure he doesn't have people food. Nate gestures over to a fat CAT sitting on the window sil NATE (cont'd) Uh...plants are fake...except the orchid on the table, but I just watered it...uh, bring in the mail...you don't have to answer the phone, I'll retrieve my messages.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: What if you want to call me?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I'll ring once, hang up, then call right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara is dressed in an oversized sweater of Nate's. She smells it periodically, staring at two WOMEN selling rhinestone jewelry on the home shopping network. The BUZZ rings. Tara gets up and heads for the intercom.  15.

dialogues.speaker: DANA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Hey, freaklet. It's us.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I don't feel like going out.

dialogues.speaker: DANA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: That's why we're coming in! Hurry up, it's fucking freezing!

dialogues.speaker: COUCH
dialogues.text: JAMES, great-looking, tight T-shirt, gay, and RICHARD, he cubicle mate, standard Gen X uniform of worn corduroys an bowling shoes, bookend Tara. The television is a Sony fla screen, huge. Dana and James play a reality video game - BOXING.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t take it personally, there are no casual conversations about exes when it comes to women -—

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: We have them all the time -~-

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: But we’re not sleeping together. Men know not to share any of that stuff with women, they remember everything. It’s amazing, really, the recall. Every little detail, every name, every single thing is stored up like ammo, all to be used for future fights.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I’m not like that.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: You think you’re not like that.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: But...aren’t you curious to learn what her ex-boyfriends were like?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What, so I can hear about what great sex they used to have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana throws down the controls, reaching for her wine. Jam gets up and writhes around in a victory dance.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This deserves a celebration! He reaches in his bag, presenting a page of stickers to t

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Why would we want Bugs Bunny stickers?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: It's acid, Laura Ingalls. Tara throws them back at James.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: We’ re not dropping acid on a school night, you freak.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Ecstasy?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: How is it that you never have any money to go out to eat, but you're a walking drug lord? The BUZZER rings. TARA (cont'd) Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I invited some people to come up —~-

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: We're not having a party here, James.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: But this apartment is so great -—

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: No. No. No -- But as she is saying "no" James is buzzing them up.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I can't leave them out in the cold like that.  17.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: (to Dana) Did you know about this?

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: (yes) No. (beat) But you do have all that alcohol left over from Nate's party...

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Uncle Pussy, the cat, sits by an empty bowl. He leaves th kitchen, heading for the:

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: He sniffs around the empty pizza boxes, his nose leading to James' bag. We see Uncle Pussy find the ACID TABS, and begin to lick them. PEOPLE arrive, Tara never notices Unc Pussy.

dialogues.speaker: APARTMENT
dialogues.text: The MUSIC blares. Tara follows a drunk-looking GUEST arou finally extracting his glass of red wine out of his hand. She takes a cigarette out of someone else's in one deft maneuver. We see there are at least a DOZEN PEOPLE here n Tara gets to the stereo and turns it off.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: PARTY IS OVER. Good night. There are various moans and groans, but PEOPLE obey. TARA (cont'd) BYE, BYE...A LITTLE FASTER, THANK YOU.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara puts on Nate's robe. Uncle Pussy lays on the bed. As Tara passes, Uncle Pussy turns his head left to right to watch, and then repeats this a dozen times. Tara stops an stares as Uncle Pussy continues to do this.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Uncle Pussy?  18. Uncle Pussy lies on his back, waving a paw back and forth front of his face. He does this over and over, first one paw, then the next...watching the paw “trail.” TARA (cont’d) What are you doing? Tara gasps, covering her face.

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uncle Pussy? Tara looks down on the bed to see only half a page of the acid left. TARA (cont'd) Oh my God! Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara RACES in, straight up the desk. She holds a cat cage with Uncle Pussy inside. An eager INTERN greets her.

dialogues.speaker: INTERN
dialogues.text: Good morning! Did you sign in?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I have an emergency -- my cat ate a couple of tabs of acid.

dialogues.speaker: INTERN
dialogues.text: Okeydokey, acid as in...

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Drugs. As in hallucinogenic drugs -— The intern leans down to the cage and waves his hands.

dialogues.speaker: INTERN
dialogues.text: He's trippin'? Whoa...that's kinda cool -~

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Please --

dialogues.speaker: INTERN
dialogues.text: (snaps back up) Sorry. Name of pet?  19.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Uncle Pussy.

dialogues.speaker: INTERN
dialogues.text: Soprano fan, uh? (off Tara’s nod) Last name?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Goodman. He does some rapid typing.

dialogues.speaker: INTERN
dialogues.text: No Uncle Pussy Goodman here.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Well...this is his vet.

dialogues.speaker: INTERN
dialogues.text: (typing) I can do a Pussy search. Yeah...okay, we have two Pussies. But not all uncles...oh, yeah, here it is. Tara nods, relieved. INTERN (cont'd) It was under your name, Jessica... (trouble pronouncing it) Fuka - Fukunaga? He looks up at Tara.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: That's not it.

dialogues.speaker: INTERN
dialogues.text: 2306 West 84th Street? He slides the piece of paper over to Tara who stares at t information.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: That's it...that's the address.

dialogues.speaker: INTERN
dialogues.text: We have the owner listed as a Jessica Fukunaga...at that address. Tara's completely lost, staring at the woman's name.  20.

dialogues.speaker: INTERN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, here it is, in case of an emergency contact Nate Goodman, same address.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: This must be her... The guy waves his hand in front of Tara's face, she fails react. He tries to take the piece of paper back. Tara won let go.

dialogues.speaker: INTERN
dialogues.text: I can update the info --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: INTERN
dialogues.text: Alrighty then. (looking at Tara) I didn't think you looked like a...Fukunaga -- bdum, dum. Tara looks up from the paper. INTERN (cont'd) So...how did this little guy score the acid anyhow? Tara freezes him with an ice cold stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara puts the key in the door and enters Nate’s apartment

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Tara places the cat cage down gently. Tara opens the door Uncle Pussy runs out, and Tara follows the cat with her e Tara looks around the apartment as if entering it for the first time. Tara notices the carefully selected art print on the walls. The low mahogany coffee table with a fresh, white orchid growing out of a ceramic pot. Linen curtains that match the throw pillows.  21. Suddenly, it’s so obvious. This is not the apartment of a lonely bachelor. Tara is overwhelmed by jealousy as she takes it all in.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nate? Sweetheart, is that you? Tara turns around slowly to see a beautiful, JAPANESE WOM come out from the bedroom. Her long, black hair hangs bel her waist. She wears a short, red silk kimono. Nate catches up to her, KISSING HER NECK. They slowly sin to the floor, making out just inches from Tara. Tara turns her head, only to see them coming through the front door with groceries, LAUGHING AND KISSING. Tara RUNS to the kitchen, and there they are making Sunda morning waffles together. She turns and runs past the dining room where they are painting the walls “drop of green”. JESSICA FUKUNAGA IS EVERYWHERE. Tara walks to the balcony, opens the sliding glass doors get some fresh air. But there is no escaping it; there they are, sitting on the chintz pottery barn love seat, Jessica’s head against Nate’s shoulder. Nate takes her fa in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Jessica...I love you. I love you so much... Tara shuts the door, leaving the apartment immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara rushes in, glancing at Dana. Dana runs a finger acro her throat, pointing at her boss's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara knocks on the door, enters.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Tara gently closes the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. My boyfriend's cat -—

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: So many of your excuses start with my boyfriend. My boyfriend this and my boyfriend that --

dialogues.speaker: TARA

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I'll use this -- The GUY turns around slowly, still holding onto Pippa's h

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: You’ re not going to use that --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: My Dad gave it to me for Christmas, he’d be disappointed with me if I didn’t. The guy sees the zapping electricity and the look of stee determination on Tara's face. Clearly, she's not backing The Guy laughs, but let’s go of Pippa, backing away -~

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: I’1l see you, later. He jumps into the cab and it pulls away. Pippa stares at Tara, her mascara running down her face.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: (shaking) You better put that away. They look at one another, bursting into nervous laughter. They calm down, Pippa puts out a shaking hand. PIPPA (cont’d) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. NATE’S APARTMENT - ENTRY WAY ~ MORNING Tara and Dana walk past the DOORMAN with a nod. Tara carr a grocery bag, Dana a tray of coffees.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I don’t know where I got the adrenaline rush, or the courage, it was like when you hear about those women whose babies are trapped beneath cars and then get that super human strength -—

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: You lifted a car?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: No. But this was a big guy. And now Pippa and I are going to have dinner. I have to admit, I was amazing. And there’s this bond now between us...I feel like we could really be friends.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: But, is she the love of Nate’s life?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Probably not, but I’1l find out stuff, maybe she’1l know who this model was. I don’t know, I’m almost afraid to say it, but meeting his ex-girlfriends is easy -- Tara looks outside to see JESSICA FUKUNAGA talking her wa past the DOORMAN. She carries an empty cat cage. TARA (cont’d) Oh my God. It’s Jessica Fukunaga -~ Tara looks around as the elevator door finally opens. Tar pushes Dana

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Tara manically pushes the CLOSE button. The doors come together and Tara sighs with relief. Suddenly, a FOOT jam into the door. Jessica Fukunaga steps on. Tara, too late, lifts her grocery bag in front of her face. Jessica glances at Tara for a beat, then turns forward. After a moment, she turns back.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA FUKUNAGA
dialogues.text: You look really familiar...oh, oh, you were -~

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara lowers the groceries.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: A patient, hi, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA FUKUNAGA
dialogues.text: Good, wait, so you live here? I saw your form, it didn’t list --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I’m moving. My friend lives here. They all nod, glancing ahead. Jessica sees the only floor lit is number 3.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA FUKUNAGA
dialogues.text: Wait, you live on the third floor? I used to live on the third floor. Tara pushes Dana slightly.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: She lives with her boyfriend...on the third floor.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA FUKUNAGA
dialogues.text: Oh...God, this is so embarrassing. It’s not, Nate Goodman by any chance?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Oh my God -- (shoving Dana) What a coincidence!

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: (rubbing her arm) Yes. Well, I don’t know what to say —— Dana shoots Tara a look.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA FUKUNAGA
dialogues.text: Nate’s not back from his business trip? Dana looks at Tara, then back to Jessica Fukunaga. The elevator doors open. They all step out to:

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: No...no, still away. So, why are you stopping by?  45.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA FUKUNAGA
dialogues.text: I know this is a really weird question, but could I come in and see the cat? Tara looks down and stares at the EMPTY CAT CAGE.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: No -- They all look at Tara. TARA (cont’d) He’s not here. Remember, remember how he is out being groomed? He’s a long hair —-

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA FUKUNAGA
dialogues.text: I know. Oh. Well. Tara stares at Jessica’s cat carrier.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: So, why the cat cage? Jessica looks down at it guiltily.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA FUKUNAGA
dialogues.text: (handing it to Dana) It’s silly to have a cat cage...and no cat. I just thought I’d...give it to you. Dana accepts the cage. Jessica backs away. JESSICA FUKUNAGA (cont’d) Don’t tell Nate I stopped by. They watch her run to the stairwell. Tara puts her hand o her heart.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Was she crying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pippa downs an oyster out of the shell. Everything she do is sensual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an alley, in the back of a cab, in the movie theater on Beaker street, the women's bathroom of TGI Fridays, the diaper changing station...we broke it and every time I go in there I feel guilty, it's still on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: He likes TGI Fridays? Pippa shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: (offering her sushi) Sea urchin? Tara shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: All those public places? He liked that?

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: Look to gay men if you ever have a question about what straight men like. Gay men like hot looking guys with perfect bodies, right?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Yeah...I guess.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: Well, so do straight men. Even ugly little trolls that don’t deserve to see the light of day like their women to be hot. And sex...gay men love sex in public places...hello, road side stops, public bathrooms, theaters, parks? You sprinkle in a few new tricks like that into your relationship and that man is yours.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Wow. But you’re no longer with that guy...uh...?

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: Nate?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: (nodding) Were you engaged?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engaged? Ha! He called me the other night, probably for a quickie. That’s the problem with being great in bed, you often get the lonely late night call just to see if you’re up for it.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Has he called you for those? Pippa thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: No...come to think of it. (sighs) He was different. I guess he was different. Pippa throws back another shot of saki. She suddenly look very sad and very drunk.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In fact, he broke up with me because he didn't feel right sleeping with me when it wasn't emotionally going anywhere. a Well, whose fault was that? I wanted it to go somewhere, it wasn't me who wasn't moving it forward --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Maybe it was for the best --

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: Maybe it's what ruined my life. (tears up) There was no closure. It was just over. Tara awkwardly pats her hand.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: You’re so talented, Pippa...you could use these feelings in your work...create the closure that you need. Trying to focus on Tara.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: Yeah. ..maybe. (sighs) Do you know what it's like to love a guy so much...do everything you can to keep him, and then he leaves you?  48.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I...can imagine it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pippa leans on Tara, unable to stand on her own. Tara ope the door to the cab, gently depositing Pippa.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Okay, tell the driver where you live.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I...don't know, where do you live, Pippa?

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: In that big place...by that thing. Tara stares at Pippa for a long time. Pippa starts laughi

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. DANA’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Tara drags Pippa into the apartment. She attempts to be quiet, but Pippa drunkenly stumbles around, pulling down lamp as they enter. Dana suddenly appears in pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Oh no, no, Tara...this isn't good.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: She doesn't remember where she lives. I had no choice. Dana rights the lamp, Pippa twirls around, knocking it to floor before she lands beside it.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: This was my Grandmother’s, please.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Just stay there, Pippa. Don’t move. Tara quickly runs around the apartment, taking down photo Nate. She stashes them in the hall closet, Dana follows.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: She’s not a puppy, Tara, you, you can’t have her stay here. That’s crazy —~

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: (whispers) I can’t take her to Nate’s. Right? Tara walks back to Pippa, dragging her towards her bedroo

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Not cool. Totally un-cool. Dana watches Tara struggle with Pippa's limp form, sighs, then pitches in. They drag Pippa into TARA’S BEDROOM Depositing her on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Well...did you learn anything?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Yeah, he likes to have sex in public Nae places -~

dialogues.speaker: DANA PIPPA
dialogues.text: Really? Who doesn't? Tara takes off Pippa’s cowboy boots, throws a blanket on of her, shutting the door.

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks, Dana. I knew you’d understand --

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa...where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I’ve got to go back to Nate’s place, feed Uncle Pussy. Dana blocks the front door with her body.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: You’re not leaving her here with me. She could be a total fucking psycho.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: ~ She’s not.  50.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Okay, I think this is officially getting out of hand. Today with pretending to be Nate’s girlfriend and then -- Tara pries Dana away from the door.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: You encouraged me to do this, you’ve got to help me out here just a little. (beat) When you leave for work tomorrow, just get her up and tell her she has to leave. I’m sorry I have to do this, but I can’t starve Uncle Pussy. Tara kisses Dana on the cheek and bolts.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. NATE’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Tara lies in bed on the phone, Uncle Pussy next to her. NATE’S VOICE I've been trying to phone you for two days. I did the code, you didn't answer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate sits alone on the hotel bed. INTERCUT:

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Is everything alright, you are spending nights there, right?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was just --

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Is Uncle Pussy alright?

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: INT. NATE’S APARTMENT

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Yes...why do you keep asking --

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Has anyone come by and tried to take him...?  Tara is silent a moment. NATE (cont’d) Tara?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: It’s just I’ve retrieved some strange messages from...someone, and she said she met you, but it didn’t sound like you -—

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I...have no idea what you’re talking about. Nate, what are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: It’s...an old girlfriend, she wants Uncle Pussy back. It could get ugly. Tara sits up straight in bed.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I’ll take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What? Tara gets out of bed, begins pacing.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Time will take care of it --

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: This cell phone service sucks --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (beat) I said...I miss you so much.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: When are you coming back?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I was going to come back early, but my firm wants me to check out a company in Los Angeles. You’re not mad? 51.  52.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: No...just...take whatever time you need, everything here is fine. (beat) Nate...are you happy with our sex life?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Yes...aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Yes...but...is there anything else you want to do...would you like to...that I'm not doing...I don't know, try something different?

dialogues.speaker: NATE'S HOTEL ROOM
dialogues.text: He closes his laptop, the bed is littered with paper work

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Are you trying to torture me, here? I haven't seen you in days, I'm all alone in a hotel room. I hope you're bringing this up because you want to have phone sex.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Would you like that?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Uh...would you like to...? Nate lies back down on his bed. Tara giggles nervously.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: How do we start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rows and rows of cats in cages. Tara points to one. The L TECH gets it out of its cage. It is a long hair cat, simi to Uncle Pussy. Tara holds it, kisses him.  53. INT. WELL HEALTH CENTER - DOCTOR’S OFFICE - MORNING Tara stands at the counter, pushing it towards the RECEPTIONIST, a note attached to the cage. The Receptioni pushes it back.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: This is a doctor’s office, not a vet -~

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: But Dr. Fukunaga is expecting this, trust me -~ Tara begins to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: You cannot leave this here -~

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: There’s a note, believe me, she will want this cat. Now, I have to go back to work. Tara RUNS out before she can catch her.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Tara repeatedly presses the down button, when Jessica Fukunaga appears carrying the cat cage.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA FUKUNAGA
dialogues.text: Uh...excuse me, excuse me -- what is this all about?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Oh...hey, I just dropped off the cat for you --

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA FUKUNAGA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I know you were pretty upset about your old cat, so I found the same cat that you described...uh, I work part time for animal rescue, that cat was going to be -- (draws hand across throat) So, enjoy -- Jessica Fukunaga looks completely confused.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA FUKUNAGA
dialogues.text: I don’t know if I can take this...uh..  54.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Tara --

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA FUKUNAGA
dialogues.text: (saying name over) Tara...oh, Ms. O’Connor, I was to call you today...you need to make another appointment. Your Pap Smear came back abnormal. Tara turns to face her.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Abnormal? What, what does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. JESSICA FUKUNAGA’S OFFICE ~ DAY Jessica gets out her file.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA FUKUNAGA
dialogues.text: It’s often times a lab error...

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: And other times?

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA FUKUNAGA
dialogues.text: It’s probably a lab error.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Oh my God...do you mean cancer?

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA FUKUNAGA
dialogues.text: It could be just a clump of pre-cancerous cells. If caught this early it shouldn’t pose a risk --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Oh my God. I’m going to die.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA FUKUNAGA
dialogues.text: You're not going to die. And please, you can take the cat back --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Please... Tara takes the sweet cat out of his cage, puts him on her TARA (cont’d) It’s my dying wish that you take this cat. He needs a good home.  55. The cat nuzzles Jessica. She melts, hugging him back

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CHAT MAGAZINE OFFICE - TARA’S DESK — MORNING Tara rushes into the office. Dana GLARES at her, Tara wal past, oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: She’s still there. Tara stops, backtracks.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Who’s still there?

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Pippa...still there. Did you give her a key?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Uh...I told her to just put it under the mat. I/’1l... Tara looks over and sees Audrey yelling at someone on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’1l go back at lunch and make sure she’s out.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: (sotto voce) If you still have a job. OUTSIDE AUDREY’S OFFICE - MORNING Tara knocks lightly, then enters.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY LANFORD'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Tara ENTERS Audrey’s office. It looks out over Times Squa The view from the window behind her shows the billboard i progress. TINY MEN hang from scaffolding, finishing the work. Half of the model’s face eerily stares ahead.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Uh...Audrey...I’m sorry I was late, I had a doctor’s appointment that ran over.  56.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: (still typing) You're only twenty minutes late. Why bother apologizing at all? Tara winces, watching her continue to type. The phone rin Tara reaches for it, but Audrey beats her to it.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Audrey Lanford's office. Oh, Henry, hello...it’s me, Audrey. Audrey swivels her chair away from Tara. Tara walks back

dialogues.speaker: HER DESK
dialogues.text: Where Pippa sits behind it. Tara gasps, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: Hey. Tara casually takes a framed photo of Nate off the edge o the desk, pocketing it.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: How did you know...

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: You mentioned you worked here. (beat) To thank you for letting me crash, I brought some things to help you out with your sexual problems. Pippa says it rather loudly. Dana stares at the whole thi from across the way, as does a few of her office neighbor

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: (whispering) I really don’t think this is the place -- Pippa stands, dumping a bunch of SEX TOYS onto Tara’s des

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: Okay...this boyfriend of yours. Does he like you to put your finger up his --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Pippa - please. (glancing around) I’ve never done that.  S57.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: Oh, honey. Guys love that...remember the whole gay sex conversation we had? Love it. Pippa dangles a dayglow, wiggly plastic thing. PIPPA (cont'd) This looks like a soap dish, but I’m telling you, have him wear it and it will drive you crazy. Audrey comes up to the desk, peers over it.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I’m coming --

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: You will once you start using these -—

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Uh...Audrey, I’m working on a story idea for the magazine about... (looking down at sex toys) Pleasing your man by...pleasing yourself. Audrey turns on her heel.

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry, very busy here Pippa...uh, I’11 talk to you later?

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: Sure, just, thanks for letting me crash. Pippa walks away. Dana gets up and stares at her back as leaves. Dana yells over to Tara’s retreating form.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Those better not be my shoes she’s wearing - can she afford Manolo Blahniks? Dana gets up and tries to catch her before the elevator d close. AUDREY’S OFFICE - SAME Tara is about to sit down when she looks out the window t see that the final piece of the Calvin Klein billboard ji puzzle is now in place. Staring back at her is the WOMAN FROM NATE'S PHOTOS - Tara GASPS, dropping her coffee and spilling it all over Audrey's desk  58.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: This desk is teak -- my papers -~ Tara SWIPES everything off the desk top and onto the FLOO Completely rattled she takes off her sweater and begins t mop up the mess. The phones start ringing off the hook. Dana walks in.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Dan Albright on line two -- is that my sweater?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I'll get it dry-cleaned. Dana gives her an icy stare and retreats. TARA (cont'd) (after Dana) Sorry -- (to Audrey) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Just...get out.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: But I can --

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE LOBBY
dialogues.text: Tara leads Dana over to the window. They stare out togeth

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: The billboard. It's her. That's —— Tara extracts a PHOTO from her pocket, holding it up to t glass.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Nate's model.  59.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I’m sure this is the one he was in love with. Look at her...she’s perfect. Dana pulls Tara away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Don’t you think you’ve learned enough? It was an experiment, it didn’t work.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: But Dana, I haven’t met the woman he was in love with yet. Once I talk to her, I don’t need to meet any more of his ex- girlfriends. Tara turns, stares straight into the model’s face. TARA (cont’d) That’s her. I feel it.

dialogues.speaker: SAN FRANCISCO
dialogues.text: The Boss Man and Nate stand on the deck, Alcatraz looms i the distance.

dialogues.speaker: BOSS MAN
dialogues.text: You can’t come to San Francisco and not see Alcatraz.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Quite a sight, sir.

dialogues.speaker: BOSS MAN
dialogues.text: So what do you think, are you going to come work for us? Nate looks off to Alcatraz

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I need to think it over, can I have a week?

dialogues.speaker: BOSS MAN
dialogues.text: Sure. You’re staying through the weekend, right?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I’m actually going to go home early, surprise my girlfriend. (beat) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATE (cont'd) We have a lot to talk about when I return.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. STREET - DANA’S APARTMENT Pippa instructs two MOVING MEN who carry her see-saw peni sculpture off a truck.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: Careful, careful... She props open the door, standing aside. They stagger beneath the weight.

dialogues.speaker: MOVER
dialogues.text: You can’t hold it by the shaft, hold it by the balls --

dialogues.speaker: MOVER
dialogues.text: Man, if you think it’s so easy, you hold it by the balls. The tip is much easier, so shut the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORGEOUS MODELS work the catwalk. The most outrageous fashions from the world's top designers.

dialogues.speaker: BULLPEN
dialogues.text: MEDIA MONGRELS climb over each other, hungrily snapping a the models who pass by, jostling Tara and Dana about.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I don't stand a chance. If she is asking about Nate and wants him back, I'm through. Dana, still pissed, stares straight ahead at a MODEL.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: You’re right. Let’s hope she doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Really...is that what you think? Dana shrugs.  61. TARA (cont’d) I’m going to lose him. I’m going to lose him to a woman who is perfect. Dana finally looks at Tara, sees she’s falling apart.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Look at that model, she looks like she's straight from a concentration camp. These women are not perfect, and neither is this Kate Cates. The Model is now close enough to hold onto. DANA (cont'd) See, it's all airbrush. Bags under her eyes, all sunken in, skin is sallow...her looks says "I'm starving, please feed me". I'm surprised flies aren't buzzing around her head. This makes Tara smile.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: You're right -- you're so right! An ERUPTION OF APPLAUSE. The BEST saved for last... A DOZEN WHITE DOVES fly from back stage and from it emerg

dialogues.speaker: KATE CATES
dialogues.text: IN A SEE-THROUGH DRESS, a thin gold wire birdcage descend from around her Disney-eighteen-inch waist. Wild flowers braided through her golden locks. She is THE MOST BEAUTIF WOMAN ALIVE.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: As if she'd swallowed a Molotov cocktail.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Ohhhhh, see, that can't be real. Tara swallows hard as Kate Cates approaches. Squinting - looking for flaws. NOT FINDING ANY. VENUS REBORN.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: (whispering) No...she's flawless. A. VOLLEY OF FLASHBULBS. Kate Cates caught in an electric storm of media adulation. She winks, and sashays away.  62. The spell is momentarily broken. Dana looks at her friend Tara is crushed. Dana grabs Tara's arm, crossing her eyes, she sticks out tongue pretending to choke. Tara looks at her quizzically

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Dumb as a post. (winks) Betcha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara and Dana watch KATE CATES answer reporters’ question In French. Italian. Japanese.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: She's a supermodel with Einstein's brain. Why did he let her go?

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: I’m sure she knows a few pat answers in different languages, that doesn’t make her a genius. (beat) What's that clucking noise she's making?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I think it's Swahili.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: You better go talk to her --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: She's in the middle of a press conference ——

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: (flashing pass) You want to be a reporter, here's your chance. Tara looks at what Dana is waving. It says AUDREY LANFORD CHAT MAGAZINE.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: You took Audrey's pass, oh my God, I'm so fired --  63. Tara takes the press pass and steps forward but is halted several MEATY BODYGUARDS. Kate's MANAGER steps in the way

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Kate Cates is through giving interviews, thank you. Bodyguards ESCORT Kate Cates away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara waits in a taxi watching the EXIT DOOR like a hawk. KATE SLIPS OUT of the back of the hotel and into a stretc

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CAB
dialogues.text: Tara leans forward, nudging the DRIVER.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Follow that limo. (looking back at Dana) I'll see you at home. They peel out from the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab follows closely. They pass glamorous club after glamorous club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara stares at the expensive boutiques and glamorous hot spots that they pass — expecting the limo to pull over at minute... The limo finally pulls over to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara gets out of the cab and crosses the street just as K Cates disappears inside. Tara stops, surprised, looking a the sign for the pre-school one more time before entering

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHILDREN run everywhere. TEACHERS give chase. PARENTS pic up their PRODIGIES. Tara SEARCHES, spying Kate talking to a TEACHER in the co of the room. She holds a LITTLE BOY who struggles in her arms.  64. He drops to the ground playing with a Tonka truck, making "yrrrrooooommm vrrrooooom" noises. Tara DROPS to the floor and crawls through the maze of to and remaining children. She scoots past Kate's child, sto and takes a good look. He looks like a MINIATURE NATE. Tara wildly looks around, there's no place to HIDE. Spyin large PLASTIC TOWNHOUSE with a roof, she crawls into it. just fits, completely hidden within the structure.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WILLIAMS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He's too much for us to handle —— Tara opens a shutter, peering up at --

dialogues.speaker: KATE CATES AND TEACHER
dialogues.text: Kate towers over the tiny troll of a woman, yet looks vulnerable. The TROLL calmly sips a glass of water.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: He's a smart little boy, he just needs --

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: More attention. We agree.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Look, it's really hard raising him on my own...

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: EYES grow to the size of SAUCERS. Hearing a light knockin Tara opens the opposite shutter. Baby Nate holds out his cupped hand. Tara places her finger to her lips: "shhhhhh".

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WILLIAMS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We're finding it difficult to control him. We found him in the bathroom with a set of magic markers drawing shapes onto Lucy and Sarah's bottoms. Kate BURSTS out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WILLIAMS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm glad you find that so amusing. BABY NATE holds out his curled fist again. Tara sticks he open palm out through the tiny window.  65.

dialogues.speaker: BABY NATE
dialogues.text: Sushi. He performs the hand-off, Tara looks down: A GOLDFISH WRIGGLES IN HER HAND. Tara looks up to see Baby Nate standing on two chairs and stack of Encyclopedias, EXTRACTING yet another fish from tank. Tara opens the opposite window, looks up at Kate Cates.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: ...He said he was giving them tattoos just like his mothers'. Now it's not my place to judge -— Kate crosses the room to her son.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh, but you already have. Kate takes her son off of the tier of chairs, looks back. KATE (cont'd) . You know what, I don't want my son in such a limiting environment. There are plenty of schools in this city. Tara, still peeking out from within the confines of the playhouse watch Kate and Baby Nate leave. Tara looks up at...

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER WITH GLASS OF WATER
dialogues.text: Tara slips the live goldfish into the glass. Turning, she looks up to see... Baby Nate waving "goodbye".

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. DANA’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Tara walks in, flipping on the light. PENISES are EVERYWHERE. Tara SCREAMS. Pippa appears from the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: Oh my God, you scared me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I scared you...oh my God, Pippa, what is this?

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: I had a fight with the guy who I share warehouse space with, he was going to throw my work onto the street. Now, I arranged --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: No, no, no, no. You can’t...has Dana been home, has she seen this?

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: I don’t think so...she called, there’s a message on the machine saying she’d be out late.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Are you wearing her clothes?

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: I couldn’t get back home --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Change immediately - quick, grab a penis, we can’t have this stuff here when she gets back.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: I had to pay two moving men to get this stuff here --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Will it fit in my room?

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: You can’t pile them up -— Just then Dana walks in with James. She stares at everything, then to Tara.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: This shit can’t go on any longer --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I didn’t know this was going to -— 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara, this is worse than the time you brought home that puppy that ate my Prada boots. This is worse. This shit has to go now -~-

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: I won’t be able move it until I find another warehouse space -~—

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Oh my God, will you listen to that? (to Tara) My Dad is coming over tomorrow to give me this month’s mortgage payment. He approved of Pottery Barn for the apartment he’s paying for, not items from the catalogue of “Up My Ass Digest.” James laughs.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: Hey, that’s not fair —- Tara clamps a hand over Pippa’s mouth.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: It will be, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: (looking at Pippa) Are you wearing my clothes —~ Dana LUNGES at Pippa, pulling at her clothes and hair. and James step in, pulling them apart.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Dana, I’m sorry. James drags Dana to the door.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: No, I’m sorry, you're going to have to find a new place, Tara.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: You're fired. 67. Tara

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I have an amazing idea --

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I’ve already heard that you were at the Calvin Klein show...reporters working for this magazine saw you in the VIP room, and then I started to wonder how could that be? I search around in my little desk and low and behold...no press pass. (standing) Good luck elsewhere, I'm not sure you'll want a reference from me -— Tara silences her by HOLDING UP HER HAND. Audrey stops, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Models with Toddlers, kind of an exposé on working models with children...their challenges, we always think of models being these sex goddesses, perfect bodies, but how do they handle the challenges of motherhood and —- Audrey backs Tara out of her office. RICK JENKINS, Audrey boss, comes to the door, listens.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: You’1l have to train the new hire -—

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Think of it, Cindy Crawford, Christie Brinkley, this new model Kate Cates, have you heard of her --

dialogues.speaker: RICK JENKINS
dialogues.text: That is a great idea, Audrey. Women are always complaining about how sexist our interviews are, but that idea should appeal to a lot of women.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I was hoping to make that my first story, sir --

dialogues.speaker: RICK JENKINS
dialogues.text: Great idea. Get to it. Audrey looks at Tara and scowls. Tara smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Countless MODELS, ACTORS and BEAUTIFUL BODIES leap and ki in unison to a throbbing techno beat. Except...

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: STEPS right when everyone else steps LEFT. She's WATCHING KATE CATES in the mirror. Tara turns, slamming into -—

dialogues.speaker: AMAZON ON HER RIGHT
dialogues.text: Get the fuck off my step -~ XENA SHOVES Tara into the AMAZON ON HER LEFT, who SHOVES BACK.

dialogues.speaker: AEROBICS INSTRUCTOR
dialogues.text: (into headset microphone) You, in the second row, beginners step is next class. Tara, red-faced, ducks out.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Tara now slumped against the wall, waits...sees Kate EXIT Tara pushes through the SWEATING MASSES --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Hi, hi Kate Cates...excuse me...I'm Tara O'Connor from CHAT MAGAZINE. Kate looks at her blankly. She is SO BEAUTIFUL. TARA (cont'd) The article, "Supermodel Mommies"?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: God, I don't even remember...that. (sighs, looking at watch) I'm going to work out for another hour, but maybe you can interview me while we work out. Tara tries to look enthusiastic.

dialogues.speaker: PUNCHING BAG STATION
dialogues.text: Tara holds the huge bag. Kate punches and kicks it.  70.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I could have -- an army of people -- (punch, punch, kick looking after Joshua, but I want him to be a part of my life. (kick) I had him because I wanted him. But his father... Kate UNLEASHES HER RAGE -~ KATE (cont'd) ...is too immature to handle fatherhood.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Who is he...the father?

dialogues.speaker: TREADMILLS
dialogues.text: Kate RUNS like the BIONIC WOMAN. She shows no signs of tiring. Tara on the other hand...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about him --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: (panting) But...who...is...he? Tara looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I was never one of those women who wanted to be a single mom, either. I don't think it's necessarily hip, it's hard.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I'm sure you do a great job. ALPINE SKI-ANTI-GRAVITY-THING — MINUTES LATER They slalom back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: So...did the father not want to take responsibility, or...?

dialogues.speaker: KATE CATES
dialogues.text: To be fair...he doesn't know.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Oh my God --  71. Kate turns on Tara quickly.

dialogues.speaker: KATE CATES
dialogues.text: What, are you going to judge me, too?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: No, it's just...how do you know he doesn't want to be the father?

dialogues.speaker: KATE CATES
dialogues.text: You wouldn’t say that if you knew him -~

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: That’s not fair. I’m sure he would take responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: KATE CATES
dialogues.text: He was only interested in me because I was a model --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: No way, you’re an incredible person. Kate smiles at Tara.

dialogues.speaker: KATE CATES
dialogues.text: You're good for my ego!

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: What if the guy, the father, doesn't want to date you, but wants to participate -- Kate's PAGER goes off, beep, beep, beep..-

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I've got to pick up Josh from the sitter. (carefully looks at Tara) Look, I'm sorry I told you my whole life's story, I didn't even give you anything you can print — it's just...you're the first normal adult I've talked to in months. Kate's PAGER goes off again. KATE (cont'd) I mean it. Models are real head cases. (beat) I gotta book, but oh, we haven't finished. I'll...I'11 call you at your office.  a 72. Kate jogs away down the hall and is gone.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. WALL STREET - SOLOMON SMITH BARNEY -— DAY Tara sits across from Alex Mernit, Nate’s best friend and His office is pretty posh, city view. He looks tense.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Whoa. You're sure?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Positive.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: How old's the kid?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Two...three, I'm not sure, but what I do know is that it's Nate's son...and she hasn't told him and doesn't plan to.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: She said that?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Yes. What are you going to do? Alex gets up and shuts his door.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What am I going to do?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: You're his best friend -—-

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You're his girlfriend --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: That's right, so why is it my job to tell him his ex-girlfriend had his baby?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: How do you know this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I'm a reporter -~

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I thought you were a receptionist.  73.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Look, I suggested this story on models with children, and she came up, and I did the research and there you have it. She had Nate's child, he doesn't know.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I just thought she took off so fast because of her modelling. (turns to Tara) You're sure about all this?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: She left for London because she didn’t want to face him.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Wow. I had no idea.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Yeah, either did Nate apparently. Alex looks out the window, rubbing his face. He slowly lo back at Tara.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Why are you doing all this...you know this might screw up your relationship.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Because...what if he's only with me because he thinks he can't have her? And...after meeting Kate and her son, I just want them to have a chance to be together...if that's what they all want.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You're amazing Tara, you know that? Really, you're doing the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Thanks, Alex. Well, I better get going. Tara turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Oh, Tara -- Tara turns back. ALEX (cont'd) How is she...otherwise?  74.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: She’s good. She’s doing well. Alex nods.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Okay, I’1l uh...tell Nate when he gets back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara sits in a chair facing Kate as she gets her hair don

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: So, you’ve been modelling for how long now?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (yawning) Feels like my whole life... Kate turns her attention to Tara, looks her over. Kate tu to the stylist, RON. KATE (cont’d) Ron, look at all her thick hair...are you thinking what I’m thinking? Ron stops fluffing Kate’s hair and stares at Tara.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I’m starting to...robe please! A GUY appears. He places a robe around Tara. The STYLIST looks at her carefully in the mirror, leaning in to liste Kate. Kate gets up, standing behind Tara.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I just had a trim --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: See, she has beautiful bone structure, but all this... Kate leans forward and picks up Tara's long hair. KATE (cont'd) ...sorority hair...obscures her beauty. Tara makes a face.  75.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I just got a trim --

dialogues.speaker: STYLIST
dialogues.text: {to Kate) You are right...this lifted and look at what is exposed! Juan, Ben, Shawnie, hurry, my supplies!

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I really don't want a short haircut --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Tara, relax, you are in the hands of a genius, and this is my treat for listening to all my sad stories! Kate leans down and squeezes Tara. KATE (cont'd) Isn’t this fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara and Kate walk down the street looking like an odd version of the Bobsey Twins...Tara's hair is cut exactly Kate's. Tara pulls at her short bob, looking into a windo

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You look fabulous --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: That's what you both kept saying. Kate stops and looks at Tara, surprised, hurt.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You don't like it? Tara can see she feels bad, instantly tries to take it ba

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: It's not that I don't like it...I mean, it looks fantastic on you, but you are a model...I'm...not. Kate looks at Tara carefully, her gaze dropping from Tara face to the rest of her.  76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right...but not because of the haircut, it's your clothes, your clothes are all wrong.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I don't think that's it. (beat) What's wrong with my clothes?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. KATE’S APARTMENT - CLOSET - DAY ROWS AND ROWS OF CLOTHES.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You hide beneath these baggy, funky clothes...that's fine for college, but you are a working girl now. You want to be noticed, you have to put yourself out there. Say good-bye to thrift stores and hello to a wardrobe that shows off your style --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that is my style... Kate throws a fun, sequined party dress up against Tara.

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See, where would I wear this? Tara turns and looks at herself in the mirror, and likes she sees, she twirls slightly, smiling. TARA (cont'd) Wow, is this Prada?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Of course and it will look fabulous on you...here, I have a sewing machine in the back bedroom -~- Kate takes the dress, Tara follows her. She stops in the hallway when she sees a black and white PHOTO OF NATE. He stands shirtless, looking incredibly handsome.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Wow...I love that photo -——

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: And I loved that man...  77. They both look at him together.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Have you tried to call him since you got back?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for? Kate smiles, nods.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You give me confidence to do things I would never do...you know, maybe I will. She holds the dress up against Tara again.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's this great party I thought we could go to tonight, Josh is going to be at his Grandma’s all night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara is in the middle of a coterie of MODELS. She is dres exactly like them, slip dresses beneath fur, stilettos, a champagne flowing. Tara has obviously had a lot. One of t MODELS opens the sunroof to the car and pokes her head through. She pulls Tara and Kate up with her. They scream and wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line around the block. The limo pulls up and the girls out. Tara looks at her watch.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Is this Halo?!! I've never been able to get into this place ~~

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You will now! Tara and the rest of the models pour out of the limo and waltz right past the BOUNCER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara dances in the middle of the models, looking like one herself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara lets herself into Nate's apartment. She calls out in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Hey Uncle Pussy..-hey kitty, kitty -- Tara reaches for the light switch but stumbles over somet in the dark -- FALLS TO THE FLOOR. Suddenly the LIGHTS go ON. Tara SCREAMS. Tara looks up to see Nate peering down at her. He wears his pajamas. Tara has fallen in the middle of his suitcases. TARA (cont'd) Oh my God, Nate! Nate, you're home early!

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: And you're drunk...where have you been? Nate extends his hand, helping her to her feet. Tara adju her dress, self consciously tugging on her hair.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I was out with Dana and then --

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Where has all your hair gone? My God, you look like a completely different person. Nate walks around Tara, who teeters on her three inch hee

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: You like it?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You look beautiful - where did you say you were again? The questions, the surprise, the alcohol coursing through veins, Tara lunges into his arms, kissing him all over.  79.

dialogues.speaker: WELCOME HOME
dialogues.text: They stumble back towards the bedroom, knocking over ever lamp and piece of furniture on the way.

dialogues.speaker: NATE'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Nate turns on the light, Tara pulls back, hiding beneath blanket.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I just wanted to make sure it was still you --—

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Where did you get that gadget?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Did you like it?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: And that position laws of gravity -- .that, that defied the

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: You didn't like it?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: How could anyone not like that...although, I don't know if I should move. Tara giggles, swats at him. Nate turns over and stares at her for a long moment. NATE (cont'd) You seem...different...and I don't think it's just the hair... (looking at her carefully) How long was I gone for? Nate pulls her close. NATE (cont'd) I missed you, Tara. I missed you so much.  80. Tara smiles into his chest.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And...I'm sorry I did that, left like that...without talking to you first.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: It's okay, please, you don't have to explain. (looking up at him) Nate...I have something to tell you --

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Wait, I want to say something first. I should have said this a long time ago... Nate pulls back, looking at Tara. NATE (cont'd) I'm not taking that job in San Francisco, I haven't told them yet, but I will Monday. Tara smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Great -—

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: But what I really want to tell you is... Nate takes her face in his hands. NATE (cont'd) I love you. Tara clasps her hands over her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: You do? (tearing up) You already know this, but I love you, too! They come together and begin kissing passionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sleep deeply...the alarm clock next to the bed reads "10:00 a.m." Tara and Nate are intertwined. Nate rolls ov and faces Tara. She awakens, he smiles.  81.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: So beautiful... Tara's hand flutters to her face.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: But I don’t have any -——

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You don't need makeup...I love your freckles...I'm going to kiss each and every one... And he begins to do just that when the DOORBELL rings. NATE (cont'd) Go away —~ It keeps ringing. NATE (cont'd) Ugh...don't move. Nate gets up and throws a robe on, Tara burrows beneath t covers, smiling. Tara listens to the doorbell ring once again. POPS up in ped...thinking...wondering...worrying...

dialogues.speaker: DOORWAY
dialogues.text: Nate opens the door to reveal KATE, bundled up, holding a tray with two coffees and a bag of bagels.

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Tara wraps the sheet around her, stumbling to the door, s peeks through and sees Kate.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Look, Kate, this really isn't the time --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Just tell me you have someone here, tell me you're with someone, I'm not pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Can we talk later? Please --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it -- Kate turns on her heel and leaves, he watches her.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Don't be mad, Kate -— He watches her go, softly closing the door behind him. turns around to face Tara.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: An old...friend, girlfriend. Alright, an old girlfriend...I didn't know she was going to stop by, I haven't seen her in years.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: If you want to talk to her, go ahead, you could still catch her -~ Tara walks to the window and looks out. TARA (cont'd) She's there, she's just leaving. 82. Tara goes to open the window, Nate walks over and stops h

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: No. I haven't seen you ina week. You're the one I want to spend my Saturday with. He envelopes her in an embrace. NATE (cont'd) I thought we could go to Manny's for lunch and then --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: (remembers) Shit. I can't. I have plans.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Can't you cancel them? Tara extracts herself from Nate, heading for the bedroom.  83.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I didn't know you were coming home early...and... BEDROOM ~— CONTINUOUS Tara quickly gets dressed back into her party dress from night before.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I want to spend the day with you. Who are you meeting --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Work. It's Audrey...we can spend the evening together?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Since when do you work on a Saturday? Tara turns from him, Nate pulls her back

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is there something you want to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: (searching his face) About...?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Nothing...it's just...you aren't upset about her...showing up, are you? Because I had nothing to do with that -~

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: No...I know. But if you want to talk to her, an ex-girlfriend, that's fine with me. Nate looks at her with newfound admiration.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: God, you're so...centered. So...secure. You know what a turn on that is? Nate begins to kiss her once again, reaching around for t zipper. Tara steps back firmly.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I'll see you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara sits up from the table, wrapping the paper gown arou her.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA FUKUNAGA
