dialogues.text: I’m sorry we had to do that again... Tara stares straight ahead. JESSICA FUKUNAGA (cont’d) Thanks again for the cat, he’s great.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Great, I’m glad.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA FUKUNAGA
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Well...I’ve been lying to my boyfriend... Looks at Jessica. Tara nods. chart. TARA (CONT’D) And some other people...it seems like I’m finally getting what I want, but...never mind.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA FUKUNAGA
dialogues.text: If you want to talk to someone...we could grab a coffee, or, you play tennis? I have the courts reserved for next Saturday.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Oh, thanks, but...I’m moving.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA FUKUNAGA
dialogues.text: Oh that’s right...out of my old place. Jessica pats her shoulder, looking down at her

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA FUKUNAGA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everything will be fine. Your results will be back in a week, but don’t worry.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. NATE’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - DAY Nate and Alex play reality boxing video.  85.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: How did you know Jenny was cheating on you?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Don’t try and distract me man, I’m winning -- Nate KNOCKS out his BOXER. Alex throws down his controls. ALEX (cont’d) Bullshit, that’s bullshit and cheating.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: She started acting different. She changed her hair...started dressing differently, and working out more. You recognize the signs. Nate sighs, picking up the controls. Alex picks his up, t start a new round. Nate’s boxer throws a few punches, alm knocks Alex’s boxer down. ALEX (cont’d) Ha, take that bitch. He finally KNOCKS OUT Nate’s boxer. ALEX (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY, HA, HA, HA LOSER
dialogues.text: (beat) What...you think Tara might be cheating?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I don't know...she's acting really strange. Alex stops Nate.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I don't think she's having an affair, man. Look, I know why, she actually came and told me something while you were gone... Nate looks at Alex. ALEX (cont'd) Nate, Kate had a baby...the kid is now almost three, it's your kid. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX (cont'd) When she left for London she left because she didn't want you to know.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I know, pretty wild.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: But...how does Tara know?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: She was doing this story, or research for some story on models with kids, and found all this stuff out --

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: That must be why she came over, and Tara was...desus, I have a kid, a, a -~

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Little boy. Congratulations, man.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Wow...I've got a son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Tara sit at a table with Joshua in a high chair.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Kate...what is it? You haven't said two words since I got here.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Men are so...disappointing. Josh throws up his hands. Suddenly going spastic, he move all his food onto the floor. They both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara and Kate walk along, Joshua fusses in his stroller. They are about to pass FAO Schwartz.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Come on, this place always cheers me up, and now I have an actual excuse to go in.  87. Tara pulls Kate into the shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate lightens up, taking Joshua out of his stroller. Tara takes him out of her arms. They begin to wander through t aisles.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: So, do you want to go camping next weekend?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Oh...I can’t...I’m, I’m actually moving in with my boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Wow, I haven’t even met this mystery man.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. About that -- Suddenly Joshua runs down an aisle. TARA (cont’d) I’1l get him -- Tara takes off after Joshua who heads for a train display She gets onto her knees, playing at the table with him.

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C'mon, let's go back to your Mom. Tara picks him up as he kicks his protest, bumping into a WOMAN. TARA (cont'd) Sorry, I --

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Tara? Tara looks at the woman and sees that it is Audrey. Joshu smiles a big, bright smile at Audrey. Audrey returns the smile and this is the first time we've seen it.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: What a beautiful boy! What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Joshua.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joshua turns and looks at Tara, kissing her. Audrey smile again.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Tara, I have to apologize, I feel so embarrassed...I had no idea you were a mother -~

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: No, I'm --

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I was a single mother, too. And that was back in the day when that wasn't so popular, but let's face it, fashion or not, it's not easy. Tara smiles, trying to explain again.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: He's not --

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: That much work? Oh, c'mon. Look, I want to really talk to you at length on Monday about supermodel mommies, how’s it going? Are you able to do the work and be at my desk --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: It’s hard --

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Well then, let’s get a temp in there and give you some real time to pursue this. If it works out, you can help me hire your replacement. (to Joshua) It was nice to meet you, little man. Audrey squeezes Josh's arm and disappears. Tara looks at Josh who smiles as if he knows he just helped her out. INT. DANA’S APARTMENT - DAY Tara lets herself in. No penises anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Dana... No answer.  89. TARA (cont’d) Pippa?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. NATE’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Nate faces Tara on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I know everything --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I talked to Alex, he told me I have a son...Kate’s son. I had no idea, really —-

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I know you didn’t. (beat) So, are you going back to her?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: No. Wait, oh, Tara, is that what you thought? Did you think I wanted to get back together with her?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I want to take responsibility for our child. I want to see him, be his father, but I don’t want to be back together with her, that way. I want to be with you. I’m in love with you. Tara smiles with relief, which is then quickly replaced b FEAR.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: So...you’re going to talk to her?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Yes, but I just wanted you to know all of this beforehand. And Tara?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Yes?  90.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Will you move in with me? I don’t want to live apart from you any longer. Tara wells up. Nate pulls her into an embrace. cuT TO: INT. DANA’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - DAY Dana and Tara struggle awkwardly towards the door with an overstuffed couch. By the look of it, they've been at thi for hours, however there's still tons of boxes and shit everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: It's never going through that doorway ——

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: It got in didn't it --

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Not through that door it didn't -~

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Just tilt it -- Tara pushes Dana through the door, Dana stumbles backward

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Stop shoving --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Lower your end -~- Dana DROPS the couch.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Nate is coming, he just had to drop by the office first - what is your problem?

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: My problem? My problem is that I'm the only one helping you...and none of this would have happened if you hadn't let that psycho stay here -~  91.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I would still be moving in with Nate, and it’s amazing to me that you forget your part in this whole girlfriend thing -—-

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Tara? Tara...hey —— They stop arguing and look to the doorway to see KATE CAT and a huge GUY watching them.

dialogues.speaker: KATE CATES
dialogues.text: I came to help you move, and I brought a friend...this is Joe, my personal trainer.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: (truly touched) You brought your personal trainer to help me move? That's so sweet!

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: (sotto voce) I'm going to be sick. Tara quickly looks at her watch, realizing what that mean

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: But -- we really don't need your help, I have some other people coming -~

dialogues.speaker: DANA ,
dialogues.text: Bull shit --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Dana, please --

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: With their help, we could finish this in an hour -~-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe the trainer carries the couch out the rest of the way his back while Kate, Tara and Dana follow with boxes. Kat and the trainer disappear back inside. Tara pulls Dana aside.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Nate is going to be here any second --  92. Dana pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: I'm not talking to you -- Tara grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Once again, this is your fault.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Let go, or I'll do damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara nervously loads Kate up with boxes.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Just take this down, and then you can leave --

dialogues.speaker: KATE CATES
dialogues.text: We just got here! Kate stumbles forward with the boxes just as NATE WALKS I THE FRONT DOOR. Tara PULLS HER BACK through the kitchen. All Nate sees is a body with boxes in front of it.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: The hallway is blocked, the bed thing, uh...could you take them down the fire escape, the door is there, at the back --

dialogues.speaker: KATE CATES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay... She teeters towards the fire escape, disappearing as Nate ENTERS the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Her, oh, a friend from work.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: And that huge guy downstairs?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Her...boyfriend.  93. Nate hugs her, kissing her neck.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Great, you got some help after all. I brought Alex. Alex POPS his head in.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hey, Tara.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Hey - we're starving, can you go and get some breakfast...please, I feel like I'm going to faint ~~

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (kissing the tip of her nose) Okay...

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: But we'll get the bed first. No point leaving without taking something. They disappear into Tara's bedroom. Tara follows into the living room just as PIPPA enters through the front.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: Tara, thank God you haven't finished moving -~ Tara lunges on Pippa, covering her mouth with her hand.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: You can't be here. Tara drags her into the:

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: I know this is all my fault and that's why you have to let me help --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: No. Dana wants to kill you -~

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: Fine --  94. Pippa heads for the living room, but Tara pulls her back.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: You should leave this way -~

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: Then I'll take a few boxes -~

dialogues.speaker: COME BACK -
dialogues.text: ‘ara throws a few boxes at her, turning, she sees Alex an Nate backing into the kitchen HOLDING THE MATTRESS. TARA (cont'd) You have to take that down the front --

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I thought you just said --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: NO. Joe has the desk down there and he has a bad knee, it's slow, please, the front the front the front, go, go GO --

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Tara RACES to the window and watches as Kate is about to ENTER the front of the building.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: (shouting down) KATE -— Kate looks up. TARA (cont'd) Can you meet me on the fire escape, I have some more boxes -~ Kate gives her the thumbs up and heads for the back stair just as Nate and Alex emerge with the mattress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate passes Pippa on the fire escape. They say "hey" as t pass. Kate ENTERS through the kitchen.  95.

dialogues.speaker: KATE CATES
dialogues.text: Now, what do you need?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Uh..-.Kate, I need...1 need... Tara leads Kate back into the living room, wildly looking around. TARA (cont'd) The bathroom...can you clean my bathroom? I'm sorry to ask but...

dialogues.speaker: KATE CATES
dialogues.text: No, no that's cool. No problem. Kate disappears through to the bathroom just as JESSICA FUKUNAGA ENTERS.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Jessica? What are you ~~

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Great place! I brought you a housewarming gift, it’s only a plant, put, really cute little place. I can help bring some stuff up -—

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: No, no, that's okay, I have plenty of help --

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: You've still got a ton of boxes down there, I’m staying until you’re finished.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: (small) Oh...I think I'm finished. Jessica EXITS. Kate Cates ENTERS the room.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Is your mop still in the kitchen? Tara nods, Kate disappears INTO THE KITCHEN. NATE AND ALEX APPEAR with the bagels and coffees. Nate ha them to Tara.  96.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I’ve just got to wash my hands. Nate heads for the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Are there still boxes in your bedroom? Tara can only nod. Dana stares in disbelief as they all just miss each other Dana turns and shakes her head at Tara.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: The laws of gravity say, what goes up... KATE CATES EMERGES from the kitchen with the mop just as EMERGES FROM THE BEDROOM. PIPPA ENTERS through the kitchen. JESSICA FUKUNAGA ENTERS carrying a huge potted palm. NATE RE-EMERGES FROM THE BATHROOM. They all STARE at one another in disbelief, various parti recognizing each other, EVERYONE recognizing disaster. SILENCE. Everyone turns on Tara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica Fukunaga walks briskly from the building. Followed quickly by Pippa, who turns and yells over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: And you think I'm fucking nuts! Whew, you take the case -~ Kate Cates EXITS, Tara on her heels.

dialogues.speaker: KATE CATES
dialogues.text: (turns) I really thought we were friends, I trusted you, Tara. What, was all that friendship just some kind of a fake out? Did you do all of that just to get to know my little secrets about Nate?  o7. Finally Dana, Nate and Alex emerge sheepishly, trying not look at this painful fight.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: (choking up) No, Kate...I want us to remain friends -- Audrey steps out of a cab carrying a gift wrapped in baby paper.

dialogues.speaker: KATE CATES
dialogues.text: I don't see why -~ (to Alex) And by the way, you're the father of my baby. I left for London because I was embarrassed that I cheated on Nate. (glaring at all of them, and then Tara)

dialogues.speaker: SATISFIED
dialogues.text: Kate Cates runs down the street. Alex, stunned, looks aft her.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I'm a father? I'm someone's Dad and I didn't even know it -— (running after Kate) KATIE, wait up -- I want to meet him, I

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Wait, Tara...that wasn’t your baby?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: No, I tried to -~

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: What you won’t stoop to, unbelievable! Audrey turns and walks away. This leaves Dana who looks at Tara sympathetically and sl walks back inside, leaving Tara and Nate to face one othe The only sound is the dead leaves blowing across the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I don't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: r don't know if I want to hear it.  98.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Okay...well, we found out you're not a father...that's good, right? Nate shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: That would've been okay.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Well then, what? Say something...anything.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Why? Why did you do this behind my back?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: It just sort of happened. Nate looks at as if to say, “you’1l have to do better tha that.” TARA (cont! d) I...I heard about Kate...and then I found out she was a model...I was worried I wouldn’t measure up. You've been with all of these interesting women.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Tara —-

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I know. I know.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What happened to honesty...and trust?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I guess I honestly wanted to know something that you didn’t trust me with. Nate turns and walks away. Tara goes to speak, her voice cracks. TARA (cont’d) And you didn’t trust me Nate, you didn’t...or you would have told me about your past. And without waiting for a response, Tara quickly turns an disappears back into the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara hovers above a young woman, JANET, who now trains fo her job. She is clearly nervous. Tara in comparison is composed, the seasoned veteran. Two lines ring at once.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: JANET, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Audrey Lanford's office. She's not in right now, may I take a message? Janet searches the desk for a pad to write on, Tara suppl her with the phone log.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: (whispers) Ask to put them on hold --

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: Can you hold please? Tara punches the second button. Janet takes down the messages.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: AUDREY LANFORD'S OFFICE — LATER Tara staggers a half dozen newspapers on Audrey's desk.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: She likes them in this order, New York Times, San Francisco Chronicle, Financial Times and then the Columbus Dispatch, she's from Ohio. Coffee, no cream or sugar, on the upper left hand corner. Phone calls or faxes on her chair so she can't miss them. When she walks in she likes the first ten minutes to collect her thoughts unless her boss, Jenkins, is on the line -~- Tara is unaware of it, but Audrey stands at the door watching. TARA (cont'd) She always wants to know when her mother or boyfriend Roger is on the phone, but she has two sisters, she usually will take Rhonda's call, but take a message from Carla -~  100. Audrey enters, nods. TARA (cont'd) Good morning. Audrey nods her hello. Tara and Janet brush past.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Don't bother telling her anything important until she's had two cups of coffee, she won't retain it.

dialogues.speaker: TARA'S DESK
dialogues.text: Tara packs the very last of her belongings. She carefully puts a framed picture of Nate on top.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: I have something to ask you...

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Yeah, anything.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: You're so amazing at this job. Can you tell me what you did to get fired, so I won't repeat it? Tara slips on her coat and picks up her box.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Trust me, there's no chance of that. Good luck, I'm sure you'll do a great job.

dialogues.speaker: DANA'S DESK
dialogues.text: Tara and Dana hug.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: I feel awful. I kicked you out of our apartment, you and Nate broke up, and now you've been fired.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I know, and it's all your fault.  101. Tara pulls away. TARA (cont'd) I'm kidding.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: You know, you don’t have to move out now. You can stay..--

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Have you called him...at all?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: No. I don't think he ever wants to hear from me again.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: It's been a couple of weeks...you should try. Dana's phone starts ringing, she runs around to the other side of the desk. Tara hoists her box up, and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATORS
dialogues.text: Audrey catches Tara just as she is about to get on.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Tara, hey. I just wanted to give you this. Audrey hands Tara a chit of paper. AUDREY (cont'd) She's expecting your call. I would do it today if you can. Tara looks down at the piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Beth Brown, the editor of GIRL POWER magazine?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: That's right. I fired her years ago- Most of the top editors in this town were once employees of mine.  102.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Thank you, Audrey. But why am I calling...I mean, is it for an assistant position...or?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: A writer...I think you're a terrible assistant. If I were you I would stick to the creative side of things. Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: But, does that mean you read my -— Audrey walks away, stops.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I'm printing your article about exes, it'll be in this months magazine in our true stories section. Tara squeals and runs back to Audrey, about to hug her, Audrey puts up her hand to stop her. AUDREY (cont’d) Please, no physical contact. Audrey turns on her heel and walks away, a ghost of a smi crosses her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara exits the building. She looks up to see they are replacing the Calvin Klein billboard. Only half of Kate Cates face looms above Times Square. Tara stares at it as PEOPLE jostle her about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face as lovely as ever, put there is something differ about the way she looks, happy and peaceful. We hear laughing, and we now see who she's been watching...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX AND JOSHUA
dialogues.text: running after each other in the park. Alex falls down and Joshua leaps on top of him, pummelling him.  103. They cover each other in the fall leaves, Josh's laugh contagious...Kate runs to join them. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica sits at her kitchen table, working. She stops whe her cat jumps into her lap, putting a paw on her shoulder She strokes the cat, looking out the window. Jessica kisses the cat and then picks up the phone and quickly dials.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hi, I was just calling to get the lab results of one of my patients. Yes, a Tara O'Connor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pippa is hard at work on a sculpture made of papier mache She works quickly, completely into what she is doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara and Dana walk out of a cute building on a street fil with cute buildings.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Are you sure you want to live way the hell out here?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Brooklyn's not that far out. Besides, I can't afford to live by myself in Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: I just feel so guilty that I kicked you out in the first place...and had James move in -~

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: No. I think living on my own is a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: But you're going to be all alone --  104.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I'm going to be on my own, there's a difference. (beat) And when I get my shit together, I'm going to get Nate back. I miss him so much. Just then a BLONDE WOMAN strolling a baby carriage passes them going in the opposite direction. Tara spins around ~ TARA (cont'd) Kate -- Kate, it's Tara -~ KATE! Tara takes a few running steps in the woman's direction. woman finally turns around, but it's not Kate. Tara puts her hand in apology, slowly turning to face Dana.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: It looks like Nate isn't the only one you miss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara knocks on the door. After a moment Kate answers the door.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Before you slam the door in my face, which you have every right to do, I just want to tell you I'm sorry ~~ Kate lunges forward and gathers Tara up in an embrace. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara sits on the edge of the table. Jessica Fukunaga walk in.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: I just wanted to let you know in person —~

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Am I dying?

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: You're normal. Completely healthy, like I said, we just had to do a second test to be sure.  105. Tara breaks down crying. Jessica puts her arm around her. JESSICA (cont'd) And even though it was completely insane, Tt understand what you did. I think we all understood. I would never do that myself, but it was kind of wild that you did. They hug. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara stands at the door, sifting through mail. She gets t rather large manila envelope and opens it. We look down t see an invitation to PIPPA ANDERS NEW WORK AT STUDIO 4. T smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara and Dana enter the packed gallery. Photographers, celebrities, rich and starving artists all mix and mingle Tara scans the room looking for Pippa, jumps when she tur around and sees Nate -~- or what looks like Nate. In fact is a room FILLED WITH NATES. CARTOON PLASTER AND METAL REMAKES OF NATE being SWALLOWED TORTURED, FRIED. Duplicates of Nate everywhere being devoured and reshaped. The plaster Nates all look alike, except for their cause of death. Tara looks up to see: NATE SUSPENDED FROM THE CEILING...over to... NATE BEING TAKEN DOWN BY A PACK OF WOLVES... NATE DROWNING IN QUICKSAND. Finally, a LARGE STEEL JAW that rests in the middle of th floor. A tiny man TRAPPED inside, covered in a slime-like substance. A tinny recording of a blood curdling scream repeats endlessly. Walking up to the steel jaw, both Dana and Tara lean in simultaneously to read the placard. The neat black on whi understated print reads, DIGESTING NATE.  106. Tara is transfixed. She looks up to see Jessica and Kate Cates as well as Alex all standing around looking at it a well. Alex whistles. Pippa joins them.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: Well...what do you think? The exhibit is called CLOSURE...thank you, Tara, for helping me with the idea.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: You’ re welcome...it's great, really, amazing work Pippa. They hug briefly. TARA (cont'd) I wonder if Nate is coming...is he coming? Tara looks at Pippa and then Alex adjusts his tie.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Uh...didn't you know, Tara?

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: He took that job...in San Francisco.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Oh? Tara instantly deflates. She tears up, everyone looks at her. TARA (cont'd) But I thought he turned them down...T thought --

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: They still wanted him. So, he said yes.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: But I was going to try and, and see him...it's too late. How could he be gone?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: He's not. Tara looks up hopefully.  107. ALEX (cont'd) Well...he leaves tonight.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: When, what time?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (glancing at watch) His flight takes off in two hours. Tara looks at everyone.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: I need to stop him...I'll never get there in time - oh God. Just then a good-looking, built GUY wearing a police unif comes up and puts his arms around Pippa's waist.

dialogues.speaker: GUY/OFFICER BILL
dialogues.text: Hey, how's it going? Pippa smiles, turning to look at her new beau.

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: Maybe we can get you there in time.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Tara, Dana, Kate and Jessica are crammed in the back of t cop car. Pippa is in front with her guy OFFICER BILL, they're practically making out. The SIRENS going.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Isn't this illegal...I mean, using a police vehicle for something -~-

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER BILL
dialogues.text: You'd be surprised how often we do this -~

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Can you go any faster? Officer Bill puts pedal to the metal, they all SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull up at drop-off.  108.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Now remember, Nate likes an honest apology, sincerity --

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Also, don't try and turn it back on him, he doesn't like to be wrong -~

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: And an offer of a blow job on the way home may not be a bad idea -~-

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Pippa --

dialogues.speaker: PIPPA
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, but just keep it simple. You fucked up, no one is permanently damaged, you're sorry.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Right. Thanks guys...I love you! Collective hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate pulls up in a cab a few cars down from them. He gets out and heads inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tara looks around wildly, heading for the American Airlin check in.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY
dialogues.text: Nate heads straight for the baggage check-in. Goes throug Tara appears, sees him right in front of her. She runs to through and is stopped by a security agent.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY AGENT
dialogues.text: Ticket, please.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: { don't have one, I'm just --

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY AGENT
dialogues.text: Sorry, no ticket, no entry into the gangway -—  109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that guy, I have to see him before he leaves, please -- can't you stop him?

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY AGENT
dialogues.text: No. Tara gives him a dirty look.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: (screams)

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: A few PEOPLE turn around, but her voice sounds small and quickly disappears.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY AGENT
dialogues.text: Are you going to be a problem, because I don't want to have to call back up if I don't have to. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: BANK OF PAY PHONES
dialogues.text: ~ Tara quickly dials.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: STARBUCKS - TERMINAL — SAME Nate stands in line, checks his watch. The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: TARA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Nate, hi, it's me...don't hang up. I'm here at the airport, they won't let me through without a ticket. Nate steps up one more in line.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: TARA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Apologizing...

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: T don't want you to leave. I want to be with you. I know what I did was insane. Nate, I'm sorry, I'm so --

dialogues.speaker: NATE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Caramel Macchiata, no foam --

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NATE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Nothing...I'm ordering a coffee...

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Aren't those a little sweet? I thought you took your coffee black --

dialogues.speaker: NATE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: When I'm at a Starbucks I splurge.

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Oh. (beat) See...I didn't know that about you....please don't leave. I love you so much...I can't just let you leave.

dialogues.speaker: STARBUCKS
dialogues.text: Nate looks back to the general area that Tara is standing The following is INTERCUT:

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: I'll call you when I get to San Francisco.

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: (chokes up) You're going? Nate visibly softens.

dialogues.speaker: STARBUCKS EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: CARAMEL MACCHIATA NO FOAM -~—

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Well...that's you.  i111. Nate starts running back to the main part of the terminal

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yep..

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCEMENT
dialogues.text: Now boarding American Airlines Flight 263 bound for San Francisco, now boarding...

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: That's you too, uh?

dialogues.speaker: MAIN PART OF TERMINAL
dialogues.text: Nate runs through to the terminal, searching all of the p pooths...he finally spies Tara, curled into the phone, fa away from him. He stops, slowly walks towards her.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Did I ever tell you about Missy Hogan?

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: From kindergarten, my first girlfriend. Nate now stands about ten feet from Tara, he watches her through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: (laughing) No...so, was she hot?

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Incredible...strawberry blonde, freckles like you have...she used to stick gum in my hair. She smelled of gum and Tinker Bell perfume...and then there was Dolly in first grade --

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: What happened to Missy? Nate steadily approaches.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: I caught her kissing someone else in the cloak room, then it was all over...but Dolly, she was a hot little number.  112.

dialogues.speaker: TARA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: I'm jealous... Nate now stands inches from Tara.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: See...that's why I never wanted to talk about ex-girlfriends... Tara, hearing him, feeling him, turns around. They face e other, still holding their phones. He leans in and kisses ner...it is a classic, romantic comedy end of the movie k Then...Nate pulls away. NATE (cont'd) I've got a plane to catch -~- He kisses her quickly and starts to turn away. Tara follo

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Are you kidding, what, you're -~

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I'm still taking the job, honey, I accepted, I have an apartment, my plane is boarding now, I have to —~ Tara, flabbergasted, tries to re-group.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: But, I thought -~

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Look, we're going to try and make this work...it will be long distance and it will be hard, but we have weekends...and then we'll see. Just trust that it will work...I think we have a pretty good chance.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Trust... They kiss again quickly and Nate stares deeply into her e

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I'll call you as soon as I get there --

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Call before...on one of those airplane phones.  113. Nate turns and runs back through security, leaving Tara a in the terminal. He turns and waves just before he walks through and disappears...but not for good. INT. DANA'S APARTMENT — NIGHT Tara sits curled up on the couch, cradling the phone.

dialogues.speaker: NATE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: That's when I was fourteen. God, was she beautiful. She was French. And then the next summer, I was a camp counselor...Monique, she was older and -- Tara nods.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, 1 think I got the picture.

dialogues.speaker: NATE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: We haven't even gotten out of high school yet.

dialogues.speaker: TARA
dialogues.text: Well...maybe we should just talk about them when it's...relevant. Tara laughs as he begins to protest.
